title: Leaders of Two Quebec Teachers Unions Approve Partial Deal With Provincial Government
description: Common front union members demonstrate, blocking the entrance of the National Assembly at the legislature in Quebec City on Dec. 8, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Jacques Boissinot)

title: Czech Republic Marks Day of Mourning for Mass Shooting Victims
description: President of the Czech Republic Petr Pavel attends memorial service for the victims of Philosophical Faculty of Charles University shooting in Prague, Czech Republic, on Dec. 23, 2023. (Petr David Josek/AP Photo)

title: COVID-19 Vaccines Can Potentially Worsen Cancer: Review
description: Colorized scanning electron micrograph of cell (green) heavily infected with COVID-19 particles (purple), commonly known as SARS-CoV-2 or novel CCP virus, isolated from a patient sample on March 16, 2020. (NIAID)

title: CCP Develops Disinformation Campaign to Interfere in South Korea’s Election
description: A woman leaves a voting booth to cast her absentee ballot for the parliamentary election at a polling station in Seoul, South Korea, on April 10, 2020. (Heo Ran/Reuters)

title: Jenrick: EU Migration Pack ‘Not Worth the Paper It’s Written On’
description: Minister of State Robert Jenrick leaves a Cabinet Meeting at 10 Downing Street in London, on Nov. 1, 2022. (Leon Neal/Getty Images)

title: Hundreds of Families, Friends, and Supporters of Israeli Hostages Rally in Tel Aviv
description: Thousands of people and the families of hostages hold up their cellphones with the torch light on to sing the national anthem during the “50 Days of Hell” rally in support of the 212 hostages that are still being held by Hamas, as another 13 Israeli hostages are expected to be released from Gaza, during the second day of the temporary truce, in Tel Aviv, Israel, on Nov. 25, 2023. (Alexi J. Rosenfeld/Getty Images)

title: Pro-Palestinian Protesters Target Zara Stores in London’s West End
description: Pro-Palestinian protesters marched in London’s West End on Dec, 23, 2023. (Lucy North/PA)

title: Quebec Police Searching for 4-Year-Old Girl Who Fell Into River
description: Quebec provincial police headquarters is seen in Montreal on April 17, 2019. (The Canadian Press/Ryan Remiorz)

title: France Grounds Flight Carrying Indian Passengers on Suspicion of Human Trafficking

title: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan Backs Cars for Ukraine Scheme in Apparent U-turn

title: Tory Right Criticise Sunak’s ‘Weakness’ Over Family Visa Climbdown

title: Finnish Study: Mental Health Issues Remain After Transgender Medical Procedures
description: Abigail Martinez (R), the mother of a transgender teen who committed suicide, sheds tears as Erin Friday comforts her and transgender activists block TV cameras from capturing her story in Anaheim, Calif., on Oct. 8, 2022. (John Fredricks/The Epoch Times)

title: Former Colombian Soldier Pleads Guilty in 2021 Assassination of Haiti’s President
description: Mario Antonio Palacios Palacios with his attorney Alfredo Izaguirre before U.S. Magistrate Judge Jacqueline Becerra in federal court in Miami on Feb. 4, 2022. (Daniel Pontet via AP)

title: Police Launch Probe Into Alleged Abduction of British Teen Alex Batty Who Went Missing 6 Years Ago
description: Alex Batty in a file photo. (Greater Manchester Police via AP)

title: Israeli-Hamas War War Dampens Christmas Celebrations in Bethlehem
description: Palestinians walk in the empty square outside the Nativity Church in the biblical city of Bethlehem, on Dec. 20, 2023, ahead of Christmas amid ongoing battles between Israel and the Palestinian terror group Hamas in the Gaza Strip. (Hazem Bader/AFP via Getty Images)

title: US Dual Citizen Taken Hostage Dies in Gaza, Israeli Forum Says
description: Smoke billowing following Israeli bombardment in the Gaza Strip on Dec. 22, 2023. (Jack Guez/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Flood Funding to Get Far North Queensland Back up and Running
description: A bar restaurant is seen past fallen branches in Palm Cove as Cyclone Jasper approaches landfall near Cairns in far north Queensland on December 13, 2023. A tropical cyclone was building strength as it rolled towards northeastern Australia on 13 December, with authorities warning "life-threatening" floods could swamp coastal regions for days. (Photo by Brian Cassey/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau Heading to Jamaica for Post-Christmas Vacation

title: Staff Shortages Fuelling Billion-Dollar Public Pay Bill

title: New Transport Minister Reveals Costs of Major QLD Projects

title: Foreign Interference Commissioner Denies Tories’ Appeal, Rejects Human Rights Group’s Concerns
description: The Peace Tower is pictured on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on Jan. 31, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Sean Kilpatrick)

title: Once-Forgotten WWI Veterans Honoured a Century Later
description: A supplied image obtained on Dec. 21, 2023, of the Minister for Veterans' Affairs Matt Keogh laying a wreath at a Commonwealth war grave created as part of the Headstone Project in Tasmania. A government grant has allowed veterans organisations to commemorate World War I veterans who did not die on the frontline. (AAP Image/Supplied by Department of Veterans' Affairs, Forgotten Diggers)
